courage failed him. He was seized by panic and could not go where it was dangerous. 
Having reached the left flank, instead of go- ing to the front where the firing was, he began to look for the general and his staff where they 
could not possibly be, and so did not deliver the order. 
The command of the left flank belonged by seniority to the commander of the regiment Kutiizov had reviewed at Braunau and in which D61okhovwas serving as a private. But the com- mand of the extreme left flank had
